ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it for the above reasons, but it is a lot of reading each week, so students should be prepared for that.

Reading realist, fin de siglo, and modernist novels, highlighting the connectedness between the movements and the role of genealogy as a creative force in them. I would recommend it, because it is a unique take on the books, and you read quite a bit.

I would recommend this course to anyone interested in literature and teaching. Although the scope of the course centers upon Spanish authors I think it is useful for anyone interested in literature and/or art.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class deepened my understanding and knowledge base of the concepts prevalent in Spanish literature. It caused me to become much more knowledgeable of Spanish culture and the language as well.

The novels we read were all very important works, and most appear on the lists for the qualifying exams. This course also teaches how to bring a new critical stance to books that have been studied a great deal.
This course geatly deepened my knowledge about 19th and 20th century literature and will be very helpful for my future research.
